subject: Business
title: Digital Twins in Supply Chains
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Digital Twins in Supply Chains.

hook.text: Unilever built a virtual copy of its entire supply chain. They test disruptions on the copy before they happen in real.

buildup.text: A digital twin is a real-time virtual model of a physical supply chain, updated with live data.

discovery.text: It lets companies simulate 'what if' scenarios: what if a port closes? What if demand spikes 50%?

twist.text: Building an accurate digital twin requires data from every supplier, carrier, and warehouse.

climax.text: DHL uses digital twins to optimize routes across 220 countries, saving millions in fuel and time.

punchline.text: Test disasters in simulation. Solve them in reality.

quiz.question: What is a supply chain digital twin?
options: A real-time virtual model of a physical supply chain used for simulation
A backup warehouse that mirrors the primary one
A duplicate shipping route for emergencies
